title: Requires all motor vehicle insurers to file annual detailed financial and claim data statements with the superintendent of insurance
summary: Requires all motor vehicle insurers to file annual detailed financial and claim data statements with the superintendent of insurance; all such statements shall be made available to the public.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          631

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced   by   M.   of   A.   WEINSTEIN,   ORTIZ,  CUSICK,  DINOWITZ,
         PEOPLES-STOKES -- read once and referred to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to  requiring  all  motor
         vehicle  insurers  to  file  annual  financial statements and detailed
         claim data with the superintendent of insurance

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative  intent.  The  legislature  hereby  finds and
    2  declares that insurance companies issuing motor vehicle policies in this
    3  state owe a duty to those they insure and to those who may in the future
    4  be insured by them, to fully disclose in a public and transparent manner
    5  all elements relating to their financial condition  and  solvency.  Such
    6  obligation  is  essential  in maintaining the public's inherent right to
    7  know the details and specifics of such  insurer's  expenses  and  claims
    8  history on a global basis so, as consumers, they can make a reasoned and
    9  rational selection of the insurer with which they intend to do business.
   10  As  premiums  escalate,  it  is more incumbent on such insurers to honor
   11  this obligation by making the public aware of the rationale they use  in
   12  determining  the premiums they charge, and it is the sense of the legis-
   13  lature that where the data used is available, it should be disclosed  in
   14  an open and public manner.
   15    S  2. The insurance law is amended by adding a new section 342 to read
   16  as follows:
   17    S 342. FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND DETAILED CLAIM DATA TO  BE  FILED  WITH
   18  THE  DEPARTMENT.    (A) FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "INSURER"
   19  SHALL MEAN ANY PERSON, CORPORATION, ASSOCIATION OR OTHER BUSINESS ENTITY
   20  AUTHORIZED TO ISSUE A MOTOR VEHICLE INSURANCE POLICY IN THIS STATE.
   21    (B) ON OR BEFORE APRIL FIRST OF EACH YEAR, EVERY INSURER SHALL PROVIDE
   22  THE SUPERINTENDENT WITH A DETAILED FINANCIAL STATEMENT TO SUPPLEMENT AND
   23  EXPAND UPON THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE STATUTORY ANNUAL  STATEMENT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03114-01-1

       A. 631                              2

    1  FOR  THE  MOST RECENTLY CONCLUDED CALENDAR YEAR. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT
    2  SHALL CONTAIN INFORMATION ON A COMBINED BASIS FOR ALL LINES OF INSURANCE
    3  AS WELL AS INFORMATION SEPARATELY FOR EACH OF  THE  FOLLOWING  LINES  OF
    4  INSURANCE: (1) PRIVATE PASSENGER AUTOMOBILE OTHER LIABILITY, (2) PRIVATE
    5  PASSENGER  AUTOMOBILE  PERSONAL INJURY PROTECTION, (3) PRIVATE PASSENGER
    6  AUTOMOBILE PHYSICAL DAMAGE, (4) COMMERCIAL AUTOMOBILE  OTHER  LIABILITY,
    7  (5) COMMERCIAL AUTOMOBILE PERSONAL INJURY PROTECTION, AND (6) COMMERCIAL
    8  AUTOMOBILE  PHYSICAL DAMAGE.  THAT FINANCIAL STATEMENT SHALL INCLUDE THE
    9  ENTIRETY  OF  ITS  BUSINESS  ACTIVITIES  CONDUCTED  IN  THIS  STATE,  OR
   10  CONDUCTED  OUTSIDE  THIS STATE, BUT HAVING A NEXUS TO INSURANCE POLICIES
   11  OR CONTRACTS OF INSURANCE INSURING  PERSONS  OR  RISKS  IN  THIS  STATE,
   12  CONSISTENT  WITH THE PROCEDURES FOR DETERMINING NEW YORK STATE INSURANCE
   13  BUSINESS FOR STATUTORY ANNUAL STATEMENT REPORTING PURPOSES. SUCH  STATE-
   14  MENT SHALL BE IN A FORM DETERMINED BY THE SUPERINTENDENT. THE FORM SHALL
   15  BE  SUFFICIENTLY  ITEMIZED  IN  A  MANNER THAT ALLOWS FOR AN ACTUARIALLY
   16  SOUND ANALYSIS OF THE INCOME REALIZED BY THE INSURER  FROM  ALL  SOURCES
   17  DURING  SUCH  YEAR,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT LIMITED TO PREMIUMS, INVESTMENT
   18  INCOME, PROFIT FROM SALE OF ASSETS AND ANY OTHER CATEGORY OR  CATEGORIES
   19  OF  INCOME  AS  DETERMINED  BY  THE  SUPERINTENDENT  TO REFLECT THE FULL
   20  DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION. AT A MINIMUM, SUCH  INFORMATION
   21  SHALL CONSIST OF THE ITEMS SET FORTH IN THE STATEMENT OF INCOME, EXCLUD-
   22  ING  THE  CAPITAL  AND  SURPLUS ACCOUNT SECTION OF THE PROPERTY/CASUALTY
   23  STATUTORY ANNUAL STATEMENT, AS APPLICABLE  TO  THE  INSURER'S  NEW  YORK
   24  STATE  BUSINESS,  AS  WELL  AS  THE OTHER INFORMATION DELINEATED IN THIS
   25  SUBSECTION. SUCH FINANCIAL STATEMENT SHALL ALSO CONTAIN A  COMPREHENSIVE
   26  AND  DETAILED DISCLOSURE OF THE INSURER'S EXPENSES ACTUALLY INCURRED AND
   27  PAID DURING SUCH CALENDAR YEAR, TO  INCLUDE  NORMAL  BUSINESS  EXPENSES,
   28  SALARIES,  COMMISSIONS,  CONSULTING  FEES,  LEGAL  EXPENSES, ADVERTISING
   29  COSTS AND ANY OTHER CATEGORY DEEMED PERTINENT  TO  THE  INTENT  OF  THIS
   30  SECTION. AT A MINIMUM, THE EXPENSE INFORMATION REQUIRED SHALL CONSIST OF
   31  THE  ITEMS SET FORTH IN THE UNDERWRITING AND INVESTMENT EXHIBIT - PART 3
   32  - EXPENSES OF THE PROPERTY / CASUALTY  STATUTORY  ANNUAL  STATEMENT,  AS
   33  APPLICABLE  TO  THE  INSURER'S  NEW YORK STATE BUSINESS. WITH RESPECT TO
   34  SALARIES (INCLUDING ALL OTHER FORMS OF COMPENSATION), EACH INSURER SHALL
   35  ITEMIZE THE SALARY OF THE TWENTY MOST HIGHLY  COMPENSATED  EMPLOYEES  OF
   36  SUCH  INSURER DURING SUCH YEAR, PROVIDED THAT THE NAME OF SUCH EMPLOYEES
   37  NEED NOT BE DISCLOSED. SUCH FINANCIAL STATEMENT SHALL ALSO  PROVIDE  THE
   38  PUBLIC  WITH  A  SYNOPSIS OF CLAIMS OR SETTLEMENTS PAID PURSUANT TO SUCH
   39  POLICIES OR CONTRACTS, LISTING THE TOTAL OF SUCH CLAIMS AND  SETTLEMENTS
   40  BY TYPE OF INSURANCE OR THE RISK INSURED. AT A MINIMUM, THE CLAIM INFOR-
   41  MATION  REQUIRED  SHALL CONSIST OF THE ITEMS SET FORTH IN THE EXHIBIT OF
   42  PREMIUMS AND LOSSES OF THE PROPERTY / CASUALTY STATUTORY  ANNUAL  STATE-
   43  MENT, AS APPLICABLE TO THE INSURER'S NEW YORK STATE BUSINESS AND IDENTI-
   44  FIED  AND  CATEGORIZED SEPARATELY FOR EACH ZIP CODE IN THIS STATE.  SUCH
   45  FINANCIAL STATEMENT SHALL BE SIGNED AND ATTESTED AS FULL,  COMPLETE  AND
   46  ACCURATE  BY  THE  CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF THE INSURER, AND HE OR SHE
   47  SHALL BE HELD PERSONALLY RESPONSIBLE WITH RESPECT TO THE ACCURACY OF THE
   48  CONTENT OF SUCH STATEMENT. THE  SUPERINTENDENT  SHALL  PROVIDE  INSURERS
   49  WITH  A  METHOD  TO SUBMIT THEIR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ELECTRONICALLY VIA
   50  THE INTERNET, WHICH METHOD SHALL INCLUDE INSTRUCTIONS  RELATING  TO  THE
   51  USE  OF AN ELECTRONIC SIGNATURE WHICH SHALL BE SUBJECT TO, AND SUBMITTED
   52  IN ACCORDANCE WITH  SECTION  THREE  HUNDRED  SIXTEEN  OF  THIS  ARTICLE;
   53  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT NO EXCEPTION AUTHORIZED IN SUCH SECTION MAY BE
   54  REQUESTED OR GRANTED.
   55    (C) ON OR BEFORE APRIL FIRST OF EACH YEAR, EVERY INSURER SHALL PROVIDE
   56  THE SUPERINTENDENT WITH DETAILED CLOSED CLAIM INFORMATION FOR  THE  SAME

       A. 631                              3

    1  LINES  OF  INSURANCE  PROVIDED FOR IN SUBSECTION (B) OF THIS SECTION FOR
    2  THE MOST RECENTLY CONCLUDED  CALENDAR  YEAR.  UNTIL  THE  SUPERINTENDENT
    3  PROMULGATES  DATA  COLLECTION FORMS AND PROCEDURES FOR PRIVATE PASSENGER
    4  AUTOMOBILE  INSURANCE,  DATA SHALL BE COLLECTED USING, AT A MINIMUM, THE
    5  MOST RECENT PUBLICLY AVAILABLE FORMS  USED  BY  THE  INSURANCE  RESEARCH
    6  COUNCIL FOR ITS AUTO INJURY SURVEY. THE SUPERINTENDENT MAY REQUIRE ADDI-
    7  TIONAL  INFORMATION  BEYOND THAT WHICH IS CONTAINED IN SUCH SURVEY IF HE
    8  OR SHE DEEMS IT NECESSARY AND WARRANTED.  INSTEAD OF COLLECTING INFORMA-
    9  TION FOR ALL PRIVATE PASSENGER AUTOMOBILE CLAIMS THE SUPERINTENDENT  MAY
   10  COLLECT  DATA  FOR  A  STATISTICALLY VALID SAMPLE OF CLAIMS. THE MINIMUM
   11  SAMPLE SIZE SHALL REPRESENT FIVE PER CENTUM OF THE NUMBER OF CLAIMS  FOR
   12  EACH  YEAR.  UNTIL  THE SUPERINTENDENT PROMULGATES DATA COLLECTION FORMS
   13  AND PROCEDURES  FOR  COMMERCIAL  AUTOMOBILE  INSURANCE,  DATA  SHALL  BE
   14  COLLECTED  USING  INFORMATION  WHICH  MAY  BE  AVAILABLE  FROM ANY OTHER
   15  SOURCE. FOR COMMERCIAL AUTOMOBILE CLAIMS, INSTEAD OF COLLECTING INFORMA-
   16  TION FOR ALL CLAIMS THE SUPERINTENDENT MAY COLLECT DATA  FOR  A  STATIS-
   17  TICALLY  VALID SAMPLE OF CLAIMS. THE MINIMUM SAMPLE SIZE SHALL REPRESENT
   18  TEN PER CENTUM OF THE NUMBER OF CLAIMS FOR EACH YEAR FOR  SUCH  LINE  OF
   19  INSURANCE.  SUCH  DETAILED  CLAIM  DATA  SHALL BE SIGNED AND ATTESTED AS
   20  FULL, COMPLETE AND ACCURATE BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF THE INSUR-
   21  ER, AND HE OR SHE SHALL BE HELD PERSONALLY RESPONSIBLE WITH  RESPECT  TO
   22  THE  ACCURACY OF THE DATA. THE DETAILED CLAIM DATA SHALL BE SUBMITTED IN
   23  THE SAME MANNER AS PROVIDED FOR IN SUBSECTION (B) OF THIS SECTION.
   24    (D) THE SUPERINTENDENT SHALL, IN BOTH WRITTEN FORM AND AS PART OF  THE
   25  DEPARTMENT  WEB  SITE, MAKE SUCH FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND DETAILED CLAIM
   26  INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO THE  PUBLIC.  THE  DETAILED  CLAIM  INFORMATION
   27  SHALL  BE  PROVIDED  IN AGGREGATE FORM FOR ALL INSURERS COMBINED WITHOUT
   28  ANY IDENTIFICATION OF A SPECIFIC CLAIM TO A SPECIFIC  INSURER.  NONE  OF
   29  THE  PUBLICLY  AVAILABLE  DETAILED  CLAIM INFORMATION SHALL IDENTIFY THE
   30  INDIVIDUAL INSURER, DEFENDANT OR PLAINTIFF ASSOCIATED  WITH  THE  CLAIM.
   31  SUCH FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND DETAILED CLAIM INFORMATION SHALL BE DEEMED
   32  A  PUBLIC DOCUMENT AND NO PERSON SHALL BE REQUIRED TO FILE A REQUEST FOR
   33  SUCH FINANCIAL STATEMENTS PURSUANT TO ARTICLE SIX OF THE PUBLIC OFFICERS
   34  LAW IN ORDER TO RECEIVE A COPY THEREOF, BUT UPON REQUEST AND PAYMENT  OF
   35  THE FEE FOR COPYING SUCH DOCUMENT, IT SHALL BE PROVIDED. WITH RESPECT TO
   36  THE  ELECTRONIC  COPY  OF  SUCH  FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND DETAILED CLAIM
   37  INFORMATION, WHICH SHALL BE ACCESSIBLE ON THE DEPARTMENT'S WEB SITE, THE
   38  DEPARTMENT SHALL HIGHLIGHT THE AVAILABILITY OF SUCH INFORMATION  TO  THE
   39  PUBLIC ON SUCH WEB SITE, AND THE LINK TO EACH INSURER'S FINANCIAL STATE-
   40  MENT  AND  THE AGGREGATED DETAILED CLAIM INFORMATION SHALL BE ACCESSIBLE
   41  IN A SIMPLE AND EASY MANNER. BOTH THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND AGGREGATED
   42  DETAILED CLAIM INFORMATION ON THE DEPARTMENT WEB SITE SHALL BE AVAILABLE
   43  IN EXCEL FORMAT, IN ADDITION TO  ANY  OTHER  FORMAT  THE  SUPERINTENDENT
   44  DETERMINES IS APPROPRIATE.
   45    (E)  ON  OR  BEFORE  JULY FIRST OF EACH YEAR, THE SUPERINTENDENT SHALL
   46  ISSUE REPORTS SUMMARIZING AND EXPLAINING THE INFORMATION COLLECTED  FROM
   47  THE  FINANCIAL  STATEMENTS AND THE DETAILED CLAIM INFORMATION. COPIES OF
   48  SUCH REPORTS SHALL BE  FORWARDED  TO  THE  TEMPORARY  PRESIDENT  OF  THE
   49  SENATE,  THE  SPEAKER  OF THE ASSEMBLY AND THE CHAIRS OF BOTH THE SENATE
   50  AND ASSEMBLY INSURANCE COMMITTEES. SUCH REPORTS SHALL  BE  PUBLIC  DOCU-
   51  MENTS AND SHALL BE ACCESSIBLE BOTH IN PAPER COPY AND ON THE DEPARTMENT'S
   52  WEB SITE.
   53    (F)  WHERE  AN  INSURER FAILS OR REFUSES TO PROVIDE THE SUPERINTENDENT
   54  WITH A FULL AND COMPLETE DISCLOSURE AS REQUIRED  BY  THIS  SECTION,  THE
   55  SUPERINTENDENT SHALL TAKE SUCH ACTION HE OR SHE DEEMS NECESSARY TO BRING
   56  THE INSURER INTO FULL COMPLIANCE.  SUCH ACTION MAY INCLUDE IMPOSITION OF

       A. 631                              4

    1  A  CIVIL  PENALTY  OF  UP TO FIFTY THOUSAND DOLLARS ASSESSED AGAINST THE
    2  INSURER FOR EACH VIOLATION, TEMPORARY SUSPENSION OF ANY RIGHT  TO  ISSUE
    3  ADDITIONAL  POLICIES  OR  CONTRACTS UNTIL THE INSURER BRINGS ITSELF INTO
    4  FULL  COMPLIANCE, AN AUDIT OF THE INSURER'S RECORDS BY THE DEPARTMENT OR
    5  ITS DESIGNATED REPRESENTATIVE TO OBTAIN THE INFORMATION AND WHICH  AUDIT
    6  SHALL  BE  PAID FOR BY THE INSURER, OR ANY OTHER CIVIL REMEDY THE SUPER-
    7  INTENDENT  DEEMS  WARRANTED  OR  NECESSARY  UNTIL  SUCH  INSURER   FULLY
    8  COMPLIES.  IN  ADDITION  THE  OFFICER WHOSE SIGNATURE IS AFFIXED TO SUCH
    9  STATEMENT MAY BE PERSONALLY PENALIZED TO THE SAME EXTENT.
   10    (G) THE SUPERINTENDENT MAY PROMULGATE SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS HE OR
   11  SHE DEEMS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER ADMINISTRATION OF THE  PROVISIONS  OF
   12  THIS  SECTION,  AND  SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS MAY BE PROMULGATED ON AN
   13  EMERGENCY BASIS IF THE SUPERINTENDENT WARRANTS SUCH ACTION TO BE  NECES-
   14  SARY.
   15    S 3. Severability. If any item, clause, sentence, subparagraph, subdi-
   16  vision  or  other  part  of  this act, or the application thereof to any
   17  person or circumstances shall be held to be invalid, such holding  shall
   18  not  affect, impair or invalidate the remainder of this act but it shall
   19  be confined in its operation to the  item,  clause,  sentence,  subpara-
   20  graph,  subdivision  or other part of this act directly involved in such
   21  holding, or to the person and circumstances therein involved.
   22    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
